titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bowyear, East India Company Resident at Bushire, to Thomas Hodges, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter gives a further report of the shortage of Carmenia wool due to the conflict in that (KirmƒÅn) region. Also reported is that Zackey Caun's [Zaki Khan] march to the coast has been delayed due to revolt in Astrobad [Gorgan], and George Skipp travels to Schyrass [Shiraz] to try to improve relations with Karim Khan. The conduct of Benjamin Jervis while he was Resident at Bushire is discussed.
